bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 3, 1952

div1.p: Siler thanks Hench for approving the increased pension for Blossom Reed. He mentions the death of Cooke.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 3, 1952
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 3, 1952
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE M. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your letter of October 18 in which you
enclosed a copy of the letter from Dr. Pedro Nogueira. Under the
circumstances, I think you were quite wise to approve the points
brought up in his letter. I have no suggestions to add.

Thank you so much for approving the increase in income for
Blossom Reed. We will take this matter up at the annual meeting
this month and I think it will be possible for us to make it retro-
active to the first of last July.

Needless to say we will miss you very much at the meeting this
year and shall hope that next year you will be able to attend.

I presume that you noticed in the papers recently the death of
Dr. R. P. Cooke in Lexington, Va., on October 27th.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd. jfs k
